page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY_DATCHWORTH
page.content: The most important landmarks in and around the village are: 1){All Saints Church}because it is over 800 years old and it can be seen from a great distance. 2){The Roman Road}which is an historical site on the South side of Datchworth Green. 3){The Medieval Whipping post}situated on the edge of the Green. 4){The Moat}that runs around the primary school and the Church. {HISTORICAL BUILDINGS The oldest houses in this area are The Horns P.H and Hoppers Hall,both built in the 16th century." {"FIVE HIDE VILLAGE"} This is the title of the book commissioned by the Parish Council about the history of Datchworth. It was written in 1984 by Mr T.O.Beachcroft and Mr W.B.Emms.
